intro: Ginalloa ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf ginalloa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Ginalloa ovata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some areas.
